name: 安德烈亚斯·比伯
name_full: 安德烈亚斯·比伯 Andreas Bieber
introduction: Andreas Bieber gained his first acting experiences at the "Unterhaus" in Mainz, where he performed in "Frank Tragelein - oder: Die Hoelle ist kalt", "Picknick im Felde", "Voll auf der Rolle", "Momo" and "Frühlings Erwachen" between 1985 and 1987. In 1989, only two years after starting training at the "Tanz-Gesang-Studio Theater an der Wien", he was offered the part of Tumblebrutus and understudy of Mungo Jerry in "Cats" (Vienna). Other leading roles in "Into The Woods", "La Cage Aux Folles", P. Burkhardt's lyrical drama "Feuerwerk" and "Gesucht: Robin Hood" by T. Enzinger were soon to follow. In 1992 Andreas originated the role of Erzherzog Rudolf in the Austrian production of "Elisabeth". Between 1993 and 1994 he also starred in "La Legende de Jimmy" by Plamondon, "Pirates of Penzance" and "Grease", before performing as Philipp in the German TV sopa "Marienhof" in 1995. In the following year he played the lead in "Blondel" during the summer festival weeks in Amstetten, Austria. Since December 1996 Andreas has been starring in the new German production or ALW's "Joseph And The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat", and is currently working on his first solo album.
